function.deleteParamTitle: Are you sure to delete the parameter?
function.deleteFunTitle: Are you sure to delete the function?
function.deleteFunTip: Once the function is deleted, it cannot be retrieved. Please exercise caution when performing this operation!
function.enjambment: It is not allowed to select multiple lines of text as parameters
function.existName: The name already exists, please try again
function.paramNameRule: Support lowercase letters and underline only
function.place1: 1. Please use nGQL to query data
function.place2: 2. Select the string and set the parameters
function.place3: 3. You can use the ontology on the right, and quickly add the class or attribute names to a statement
function.place6: 1. Only support query operation for the current graph
function.place7: 2. If you want to set an "entity"-type parameter, the parametrized selection must be a VID or a list of VIDs.
function.lineTip: Do not allow selected ; as a parameter
function.onlySingle: Graph query language only supports a single statement
function.saveTip: After the function is saved, you can go "Knowledge Network Workbench - Function Management" to view it
function.runTip: The configuration of the graph query language is not yet running
function.PleaseSelectEntity: Please select the entity on canvas
function.paramTypeTip: The parameterized selection must be VID or VID list if you want to set an "Entity"-type  parameter
function.entityRangeTip: The entity range limited when using parameters
